results:
I received a DVD of 'Boogeyman' and this extra feature was included. I assumed it was 'Boogeyman II' because it was paired with the original. But as they say, assuming makes an 'ass-' out of 'u-' and 'me.' I had read that BII contains a lot of footage from the original and stars actress Love. While watching 'Return of the Boogeyman,' I decided to stick around for the notorious death-by-toothbrush scene. However, before I knew it, the movie was over. What a rip-off. I guess I thought this was BII because it has a similar title to one of BII's alternate titles. Well, at least it was just an extra feature, right? 

Enough about my mistake, let's talk about the movie's mistakes. There were so many. Who does this guy Ulli Whatever think he is? Does he really believe the same movie will sell in different forms? Part III has nothing original to offer. It's basically a flashback of the original through the eyes of a psychic, who provides a painfully boring play-by-play of everything. That's the whole movie. Oh, and there's one death-by-stereo scene, but you can find that in someone else's review. My interest in 'Boogeyman II' is completely gone. 

Final Note: This is definitely not a series of films to watch consecutively.
